text: Thanks in the process of using this I have been testing and going to try and make some changes. What is the best endpoint to inform of change in a Contact or Deal. Through a webhook or by requesting latest changes through the an api?

Hey <@UEZJ74UN8> I’m <@UFBNA9K9A> not `@Zach` FYI.  Webhooks is my preferred solution rather than polling for changes because a) I think it’s simpler to implement and b) they won’t count against your API limit

Thanks I understand there is a different in the two webhook documentation

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/workflows/how-do-i-use-webhooks-with-HubSpot-workflows> vs <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/webhooks/webhooks-overview>

Which doc should I use and essentially the url be generated where exactly where?

You should this one <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/webhooks/webhooks-overview> and the URL will be input by you to the server that’s listening for the changes. This is the middleware piece we’ve been talking about
